<item>
	<title>The Dare: A week without emojis</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2016/01/12/the-dare-a-week-without-emojis.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">1cc5d24c-a9db-4b0e-a7c1-e9e934e79f96</guid>
	<author>Carli Stephens-Rothman - Special to the Star</author>
	<pubDate>Tue, 12 Jan 2016 07:00:00 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2016/01/12/the-dare-a-week-without-emojis/carli-emojis.jpg"/><br/>Carli Stephens-Rothman ditches the :) and shows some real emotion.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2016/01/12/the-dare-a-week-without-emojis/carli-emojis.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>The Dare: A week without emojis</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2016/01/12/the-dare-a-week-without-emojis/carli-emojis.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Carli Stephens-Rothman is rethinking that winky face after going a week without using emojis.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Ken Faught</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">For the Toronto Star</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>How I survived my two-week digital diet </title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2015/11/13/how-i-survived-my-two-week-digital-diet.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">a2749dcc-55c3-4227-9a6a-2a4d34656315</guid>
	<author>Ofelia Legaspi - Special to the Star</author>
	<pubDate>Fri, 13 Nov 2015 11:00:00 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/2015/11/13/how-i-survived-my-two-week-digital-diet/main-image.jpg"/><br/>No Smartphone. No Google. No Twitter. No texting and no music — except for a Walkman.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/2015/11/13/how-i-survived-my-two-week-digital-diet/main-image.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>How I survived my two-week digital diet </media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/2015/11/13/how-i-survived-my-two-week-digital-diet/main-image.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Ofelia Legaspi goes two weeks with old technology like the walkman, discman and a point and shoot camera.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Steve Russell</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Toronto Star</media:credit>
</media:content><media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/2015/11/13/how-i-survived-my-two-week-digital-diet/samsung-s5.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>How I survived my two-week digital diet </media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/2015/11/13/how-i-survived-my-two-week-digital-diet/samsung-s5.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>A Samsung Galaxy S5 smartphone, left, and a Samsung Gear 2 are displayed at the Samsung Galaxy Studio, in New York. New technology has gone from making calls and telling time to monitoring your health.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Richard Drew</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">The Associated Press</media:credit>
</media:content><media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/2015/11/13/how-i-survived-my-two-week-digital-diet/walkman.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>How I survived my two-week digital diet </media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/2015/11/13/how-i-survived-my-two-week-digital-diet/walkman.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Ofelia Legaspi went old school, switching her iPod for a Discman, which skipped, and eventually for a Walkman.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Steve Russell</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Toronto Star</media:credit>
</media:content><media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/2015/11/13/how-i-survived-my-two-week-digital-diet/payphone.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>How I survived my two-week digital diet </media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/2015/11/13/how-i-survived-my-two-week-digital-diet/payphone.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description> </media:description>
	<media:credit role="author"> </media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner"> </media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Party’s back on if a new source of helium pans out</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2015/08/27/partys-back-on-if-a-new-source-of-helium-pans-out.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">99f8c6fc-f1ac-4434-a92a-2c6acd2d2bb1</guid>
	<author>Robin Levinson King - Staff Reporter</author>
	<pubDate>Thu, 27 Aug 2015 17:05:23 EDT</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/08/27/partys-back-on-if-a-new-source-of-helium-pans-out/heartbeat-heliumjpg.jpg"/><br/>Used in balloons and industry, gas is hard to capture and supplies are diminishing and its price rising. Researchers think it may be found under ground.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/08/27/partys-back-on-if-a-new-source-of-helium-pans-out/heartbeat-heliumjpg.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Party’s back on if a new source of helium pans out</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/08/27/partys-back-on-if-a-new-source-of-helium-pans-out/heartbeat-heliumjpg.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Helium, the gas that fills balloons, is in short supply. It has industrial uses and the price has been increasing.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Frank Augstein</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">AP</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>YouTube prank sparks discussion of online teen safety</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2015/08/19/youtube-prank-sparks-discussion-of-online-teen-safety.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">4866facf-c40e-454b-a37c-e219aab551f5</guid>
	<author>Robin Levinson King - Staff Reporter</author>
	<pubDate>Wed, 19 Aug 2015 17:21:43 EDT</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/08/19/youtube-prank-sparks-discussion-of-online-teen-safety/childluring.jpg"/><br/>Coby Persin, whose YouTube channel is known for prank videos with a touch of social commentary, tricked teenage girls he met online to meet him in person.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/08/19/youtube-prank-sparks-discussion-of-online-teen-safety/childluring.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>YouTube prank sparks discussion of online teen safety</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/08/19/youtube-prank-sparks-discussion-of-online-teen-safety/childluring.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>According to a digital literacy organization, online predators are a rare, but real threat. About six per cent of all cybercrime reported to the police involved internet child luring, or just about 86 cases, according to 2012 Stats Canada data.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">YouTube</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>When it comes to climate change not all opinions are valid, scientists say </title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2015/06/23/when-it-comes-to-climate-change-not-all-opinions-are-valid-scientists-say.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">7219a941-e54c-4314-b318-e6418af1fd47</guid>
	<author>Robin Levinson King - Staff Reporter</author>
	<pubDate>Tue, 23 Jun 2015 20:25:00 EDT</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/06/23/when-it-comes-to-climate-change-not-all-opinions-are-valid-scientists-say/lodebate05.jpg"/><br/>While featuring all sides of an issue is a hallmark of good journalism, many in the scientific community feel that the media should do a better job of separating facts from opinions. </description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/06/23/when-it-comes-to-climate-change-not-all-opinions-are-valid-scientists-say/lodebate05.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>When it comes to climate change not all opinions are valid, scientists say </media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/06/23/when-it-comes-to-climate-change-not-all-opinions-are-valid-scientists-say/lodebate05.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>The Green Party's Elizabeth May (left)  and Lord Nigel Dawson (right) debate climate change in a Munk debate. There is a fine line between being a critic and a quack when it comes to climate change, say both scientists and journalists.

</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Lucas Oleniuk</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Toronto Star</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Cat clings to wing of plane during flight</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2015/06/22/cat-clings-to-wing-of-plane-during-flight.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">cabd61f4-52e8-41c4-810c-53e9aa6b1302</guid>
	<author>Robin Levinson King - Staff Reporter</author>
	<pubDate>Mon, 22 Jun 2015 15:04:59 EDT</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/06/22/cat-clings-to-wing-of-plane-during-flight/planecat.jpg"/><br/>A stowaway cat shocked small-plane pilot and passenger.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/06/22/cat-clings-to-wing-of-plane-during-flight/planecat.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Cat clings to wing of plane during flight</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/06/22/cat-clings-to-wing-of-plane-during-flight/planecat.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>This stowaway cat gave one pilot the fright of his life as it emerged on top of the wing of an Ultralight plane and stuck its head into the cockpit.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Romain Jantot</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">YouTube</media:credit>
</media:content><media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/06/22/cat-clings-to-wing-of-plane-during-flight/piperthecat.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Cat clings to wing of plane during flight</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/06/22/cat-clings-to-wing-of-plane-during-flight/piperthecat.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Piper the cat is the "longest running employee" at Canadian Flyers at Markham Airport.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Submitted photo</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>

<item>
	<title>The 5 best grocery stores in Toronto to find your soul mate </title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2015/05/20/the-5-best-grocery-stores-in-toronto-to-find-your-soul-mate.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">cf7972dc-2fad-4be1-ac8b-f97804abf9fd</guid>
	<author>Robin Levinson King - Staff Reporter</author>
	<pubDate>Wed, 20 May 2015 17:51:02 EDT</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/05/20/the-5-best-grocery-stores-in-toronto-to-find-your-soul-mate/loblaws-maple-leafs.jpg"/><br/>If you’re lucky, you’ll find something besides avocados to squeeze in these grocery stores.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/05/20/the-5-best-grocery-stores-in-toronto-to-find-your-soul-mate/loblaws-maple-leafs.jpg" medium="image">

	<media:credit role="owner"></media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>How-old.net guesses your age at your own peril</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2015/04/30/how-oldnet-guesses-your-age-at-your-own-peril.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">a8d5b120-be22-4b2f-a8d9-09fa853a3fdb</guid>
	<author>Robin Levinson King - Staff Reporter</author>
	<pubDate>Thu, 30 Apr 2015 17:41:17 EDT</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/30/how-oldnet-guesses-your-age-at-your-own-peril/bieberjpg.jpg"/><br/>The insult-triggering website was built by Microsoft as an exercise in machine learning.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/30/how-oldnet-guesses-your-age-at-your-own-peril/bieberjpg.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>How-old.net guesses your age at your own peril</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/30/how-oldnet-guesses-your-age-at-your-own-peril/bieberjpg.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>The site guessed Justin Bieber is 22. He's actually 21.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner"></media:credit>
</media:content><media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/30/how-oldnet-guesses-your-age-at-your-own-peril/toryjpg.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>How-old.net guesses your age at your own peril</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/30/how-oldnet-guesses-your-age-at-your-own-peril/toryjpg.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>The site guessed John Tory is 56, he's actually 60.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner"></media:credit>
</media:content><media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/30/how-oldnet-guesses-your-age-at-your-own-peril/wallinjpg.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>How-old.net guesses your age at your own peril</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/30/how-oldnet-guesses-your-age-at-your-own-peril/wallinjpg.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>The tool estimates suspended senator Pamela Wallin is 87. She's 62.  
</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner"></media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Has Earth entered the anthropocene epoch?</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2015/04/14/has-earth-entered-the-anthropocene-epoch.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">8bae6f1c-6460-43ec-90b1-a60d3e69add5</guid>
	<author>Robin Levinson King - Staff Reporter</author>
	<pubDate>Tue, 14 Apr 2015 16:08:34 EDT</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/14/has-earth-entered-the-anthropocene-epoch/trinity.jpg"/><br/>Two recent papers argue over when the anthropocene began and if it should become an official geological time period.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/14/has-earth-entered-the-anthropocene-epoch/trinity.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Has Earth entered the anthropocene epoch?</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/14/has-earth-entered-the-anthropocene-epoch/trinity.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Did the anthropocene epoch start here? Visitors assemble, April 4, 2015, at the White Sands Missile Range newly opened Trinity Site for an open house commemorating the 70th anniversary of the first atomic test there on July 16, 1945.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Jett Loe</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">AP</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Facebook still teens’ most-used website: report</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2015/04/14/facebook-still-teens-most-used-website-report.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">52f7e7fe-fa33-413b-9d7f-28962d0edba1</guid>
	<author>Leanne Italie - The Associated Press</author>
	<pubDate>Tue, 14 Apr 2015 16:00:27 EDT</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/14/facebook-still-teens-most-used-website-report/mark-zuckerberg.jpg"/><br/>In the U.S. almost three quarters use it, along with others such as Instagram and Snapchat. Twenty-four per cent say they’re online almost constantly.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/14/facebook-still-teens-most-used-website-report/mark-zuckerberg.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Facebook still teens’ most-used website: report</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/14/facebook-still-teens-most-used-website-report/mark-zuckerberg.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Facebook creator Mark Zuckerberg in one of his hoodies. Facebook remains the most used social media site among American teens ages 13 to 17, according to a new study from the Pew Research Center.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Jeff Chiu</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">AP</media:credit>
</media:content><media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/14/facebook-still-teens-most-used-website-report/facebook-on-smartphone.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Facebook still teens’ most-used website: report</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/04/14/facebook-still-teens-most-used-website-report/facebook-on-smartphone.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Facebook app icons on an iPhone.  Use of social media sites is being aided hugely by smartphones and other mobile devices, with a majority of teens using more than one social network.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">Karly Domb Sadof</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">AP</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>

<item>
	<title>Hello Barbie: Internet connection the latest trend in toys </title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2015/02/17/hello-barbie-internet-connection-the-latest-trend-in-playing-things.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">5a2a8615-b756-4030-9c51-bdcd8b246e2b</guid>
	<author>Laura Armstrong - Staff Reporter</author>
	<pubDate>Tue, 17 Feb 2015 17:55:06 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/02/17/hello-barbie-internet-connection-the-latest-trend-in-playing-things/hellobarbie2.jpg"/><br/>New version of the classic doll, which can chat with children, makes her debut at New York Toy Fair.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/02/17/hello-barbie-internet-connection-the-latest-trend-in-playing-things/hellobarbie2.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Hello Barbie: Internet connection the latest trend in toys </media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/02/17/hello-barbie-internet-connection-the-latest-trend-in-playing-things/hellobarbie2.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Hello Barbie, an internet-connected doll kids can have conversations with, was named one of Popular Sciences Top 10 Gadgets and Gizmos at the New York Toy Fair.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">handout</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner"></media:credit>
</media:content><media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/02/17/hello-barbie-internet-connection-the-latest-trend-in-playing-things/cognitoys.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Hello Barbie: Internet connection the latest trend in toys </media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/02/17/hello-barbie-internet-connection-the-latest-trend-in-playing-things/cognitoys.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description> The CogniToys dinosaur, which is in part funded by a Kickstarter campaign, is just one of the internet-connected toys showcased at the New York Toy Fair.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">handout</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner"></media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Reposting your first profile picture is the latest Facebook craze</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2015/01/15/reposting-your-first-profile-picture-is-the-latest-facebook-craze.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">a2f0d75d-3fb4-4714-a381-8c96238d6a8c</guid>
	<author>Caitlin Dewey - The Washington Post</author>
	<pubDate>Thu, 15 Jan 2015 17:00:00 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/01/15/reposting-your-first-profile-picture-is-the-latest-facebook-craze/facebook.jpg"/><br/>Essentially, you surface your first-ever Facebook profile picture — and then nominate three friends to do the same.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/01/15/reposting-your-first-profile-picture-is-the-latest-facebook-craze/facebook.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Reposting your first profile picture is the latest Facebook craze</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2015/01/15/reposting-your-first-profile-picture-is-the-latest-facebook-craze/facebook.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Facebook is abuzz with a new game: Post your first-ever Facebook profile picture — and then nominate your friends to do the same.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author">BRENDAN SMIALOWSKI</media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">AFP/GETTY IMAGES</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Toronto man looking for Elizabeth Gallagher inspires new ticket-sharing website</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2014/11/10/toronto_man_looking_for_elizabeth_gallagher_inspires_new_ticketsharing_website.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">75678bf7-07a7-4f4c-b8f2-0d20ccb0d2e3</guid>
	<author>Tara Deschamps - Staff Reporter</author>
	<pubDate>Mon, 10 Nov 2014 18:49:08 EST</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2014/11/10/toronto_man_looking_for_elizabeth_gallagher_inspires_new_ticketsharing_website/jordan_axani.jpg"/><br/>Connections allows users to post spare plane tickets and the name of the person the ticket is registered to in hopes of finding a traveler with the same name. </description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2014/11/10/toronto_man_looking_for_elizabeth_gallagher_inspires_new_ticketsharing_website/jordan_axani.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Toronto man looking for Elizabeth Gallagher inspires new ticket-sharing website</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2014/11/10/toronto_man_looking_for_elizabeth_gallagher_inspires_new_ticketsharing_website/jordan_axani.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Jordan Axani planned a trip with his girlfriend name Elizabeth Gallagher, but they split. He offered his ex's tickets to any woman with her name and a Canadian passport. Now, another Toronto man has created a website where people can post spare plane tickets with the name of the person the ticket is registered in the hope that the ticket can be used.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">THE ASSOCIATED PRESS</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>YouTube stars get screen time at Buffer Festival</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2014/10/16/youtube_stars_get_screen_time_at_buffer_festival.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">c1d622b9-0271-4502-b493-fa0ea3ba7e72</guid>
	<author>Barbara Turnbull - Living reporter</author>
	<pubDate>Thu, 16 Oct 2014 20:27:52 EDT</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2014/10/16/youtube_stars_get_screen_time_at_buffer_festival/matt_santoro.jpg"/><br/>Matt Santoro is one of numerous Canadian YouTube celebrities who will be in town for the second annual event.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2014/10/16/youtube_stars_get_screen_time_at_buffer_festival/matt_santoro.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>YouTube stars get screen time at Buffer Festival</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2014/10/16/youtube_stars_get_screen_time_at_buffer_festival/matt_santoro.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>St. Catharines resident Matt Santoro makes a comfortable living from his 2.75 million YouTube subscribers, who tune in to watch his weekly Top 10 lists. Santoro appears at Toronto's Buffer Festival, taking place Oct. 17 to 19.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner"></media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
<item>
	<title>Gamergate: Videogame industry speaks out against harassment</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2014/10/16/gamergate_videogame_industry_speaks_out_against_harassment.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">9b5f207b-5423-40d7-9218-332f981b2228</guid>
	<author>Hayley Tsukayama - The Washington Post</author>
	<pubDate>Thu, 16 Oct 2014 14:57:00 EDT</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2014/10/16/gamergate_videogame_industry_speaks_out_against_harassment/call_of_duty.jpg"/><br/>‘Gamergate’ controversy shines spotlight on the ugliest part of gaming culture.</description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2014/10/16/gamergate_videogame_industry_speaks_out_against_harassment/call_of_duty.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Gamergate: Videogame industry speaks out against harassment</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2014/10/16/gamergate_videogame_industry_speaks_out_against_harassment/call_of_duty.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>Rightly or wrongly, videogames like the Call of Duty series (pictured) have been blamed for fostering a violent culture.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">MCT</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>

<item>
	<title>Kobo launches waterproof e-reader</title>
	<link>https://www.thestar.com/life/technology/2014/08/26/kobo_launches_waterproof_ereader.html</link>
	<guid isPermaLink="false">6fc3d7e9-9245-4022-bb06-443d7b1cde77</guid>
	<author>Deborah Dundas - Books Editor</author>
	<pubDate>Tue, 26 Aug 2014 19:00:00 EDT</pubDate>
	<description><img src="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2014/08/26/kobo_launches_waterproof_ereader/kobo_aura_h2o.jpg"/><br/>Latest iteration of the electronic library can be taken to the beach or into the bath. </description>
<media:content url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2014/08/26/kobo_launches_waterproof_ereader/kobo_aura_h2o.jpg" medium="image">
	<media:title>Kobo launches waterproof e-reader</media:title>
	<media:thumbnail url="https://www.thestar.com/content/dam/thestar/life/technology/2014/08/26/kobo_launches_waterproof_ereader/kobo_aura_h2o.jpg"></media:thumbnail>
	<media:description>The Kobo Aura H20 is touted as being waterproof in a metre of water up to 30 minutes and with dustproof and antiglare design.</media:description>
	<media:credit role="author"></media:credit>
	<media:credit role="owner">Kobo</media:credit>
</media:content>
</item>
